flags.bit: Bits 31:27 Reserved, must be kept at reset value
Bits 26:24 MCO: Microcontroller clock output Set and cleared by software.
Bit 23 Reserved, must be kept at reset value

Bit 22 USBPRE: USB prescaler Set and cleared by software to generate 48 MHz USB clock. This bit must be valid before enabling the USB clock in the RCC_APB1ENR register. This bit canâ€™t be reset if the USB clock is enabled.

Bits 21:18 PLLMUL: PLL multiplication factor These bits are written by software to define the PLL multiplication factor. These bits can be written only when PLL is disabled. Caution: The PLL output frequency must not exceed 72 MHz.
Bit 17 PLLXTPRE: HSE divider for PLL entry Set and cleared by software to divide HSE before PLL entry. This bit can be written only when PLL is disabled.
Bit 16 PLLSRC: PLL entry clock source Set and cleared by software to select PLL clock source. This bit can be written only when PLL is disabled.
data: 0: HSI oscillator clock / 2 selected as PLL input clock
1: HSE oscillator clock selected as PLL input clock

flags.bit: Bits 15:14 ADCPRE: ADC prescaler Set and cleared by software to select the frequency of the clock to the ADCs.
Bits 13:11 PPRE2: APB high-speed prescaler (APB2) Set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the APB high-speed clock (PCLK2).

Bits 10:8 PPRE1: APB low-speed prescaler (APB1) Set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the APB low-speed clock (PCLK1). Warning: the software has to set correctly these bits to not exceed 36 MHz on this domain.
Bits 7:4 HPRE: AHB prescaler Set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the AHB clock.
Bits 3:2 SWS: System clock switch status Set and cleared by hardware to indicate which clock source is used as system clock.
data: 00: HSI oscillator used as system clock
01: HSE oscillator used as system clock

flags.bit: Bits 1:0 SW: System clock switch Set and cleared by software to select SYSCLK source. Set by hardware to force HSI selection when leaving Stop and Standby mode or in case of failure of the HSE oscillator used directly or indirectly as system clock (if the Clock Security System is enabled).
